meta_description: LA Plaza is an institution of stories that makes known the role of Mexicans, Mexican Americans and all Latinos in shaping the past, present & future of L.A.

accessibility_text:
### ADA - Certified Service Animals

LA Plaza de Cultura y Artes abides by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) by allowing service animals only into all the public areas of the museum.

The definition of a service animal, as defined by ADA is "any dog that is individually trained to work or perform tasks for the benefit of an individual with a disability." This can also extend to miniature horses (additional requirements for miniature horses are explained in Behavior of Service Animals below). Dogs and miniature horses are the only animals recognized animals by Federal and State Law.
